scenarioDescription:
The HD 60292 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 60292 is a star with 1.7 times the mass of the Sun, and 27 times its radius. It is located 1028.08 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 1.8 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 60292 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 60292 system


HD 60292 b

HD 60292 b was discovered by the Bohyunsan Optical Astronomical Observatory observatory, in 2020-02, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.50 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 60292 b is 2067.000 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 60292 b is 12.700 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 60292 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system HD 60292, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Bohyunsan Optical Astronomical Observatory.
name: HD 60292 - System With 1 Exoplanet
